entry.title: Crafting a Config Site Generator, Part 2 - System Crafters Live!

media:group.media:title: Crafting a Config Site Generator, Part 2 - System Crafters Live!
media:group.media:description:
Turn your videos into live streams with Restream https://restre.am/ANIm
In today's stream, we'll continue hacking on a new project that will make it possible to generate a nice website from your configuration files without writing it all in Org Mode files. Let's see how far we can get this time!

üëï https://store.systemcrafters.net üëç https://systemcrafters.net/support-the-channel üìò Get Your Copy of Mastering Emacs: https://www.masteringemacs.org/r/systemcrafters?utm_source=yt&utm_medium=desc&utm_campaign=scme üåê Buy a domain with Namecheap: https://namecheap.pxf.io/NK0yXK

entry.title: Crafting a Configuration Site Generator in Emacs - System Crafters Live!

media:group.media:title: Crafting a Configuration Site Generator in Emacs - System Crafters Live!
media:group.media:description:
In today's stream, we'll start hacking on a new project that will make it possible to generate a nice website from your configuration files without writing it all in Org Mode files. I plan to work on this across multiple streams, so come help me kick it off in style!

entry.title: Running Pre-Built Linux Apps in Guix

media:group.media:title: Running Pre-Built Linux Apps in Guix
media:group.media:description:
Turn your videos into live streams with Restream https://restre.am/ANIm
In today's stream, we'll try a couple of different approaches to run a pre-built Linux application (like Discord) in Guix. This can be pretty difficult thing to do but we'll try to figure it out live!

entry.title: Learning Paredit for Structural Lisp Editing

media:group.media:title: Learning Paredit for Structural Lisp Editing
media:group.media:description:
Turn your videos into live streams with Restream https://restre.am/ANIm
In today's stream, we'll take a look at structured Lisp editing in Emacs using the Paredit package. Structured editing packages can really streamline the editing of Emacs Lisp and other Lisps, so it's worth exploring! If we have time, we might discuss alternative packages and compare them.

entry.title: Exploring the Metaobject Protocol - System Crafters Live!

media:group.media:title: Exploring the Metaobject Protocol - System Crafters Live!
media:group.media:description:
Turn your videos into live streams with https://restream.io/upload-and-stream
In today's stream, we'll investigate the "metaobject protocol", what it does, and how such a thing is implemented. If you're interested in how object oriented programming might be super-charged by Lisp, you might enjoy this!

entry.title: Object-Oriented Emacs Lisp with EIEIO - System Crafters Live!

media:group.media:title: Object-Oriented Emacs Lisp with EIEIO - System Crafters Live!
media:group.media:description:
In today's stream, we'll take a look at the EIEIO library for Emacs Lisp to learn how you might write object-oriented code for your configuration or custom packages. This library is based on the Common Lisp Object System, so if you've got a general interest in Lisp you'll want to check this out!

entry.title: Distilling the Essence of Emacs - System Crafters Live!

media:group.media:title: Distilling the Essence of Emacs - System Crafters Live!
media:group.media:description:
In today's stream, we'll discuss the unique aspects of Emacs that make it the most hackable program to ever exist. How does it accomplish this hackability? Is it possible to replicate the Emacs experience in other programs?

entry.title: Automating Tasks with Emacs Lisp - System Crafters Live!

media:group.media:title: Automating Tasks with Emacs Lisp - System Crafters Live!
media:group.media:description:
In today's stream, we'll automate a particular task that I don't find very fun: editing YouTube video descriptions. We'll use Emacs Lisp to interact with the YouTube Data API to pull down a video's description, edit it in a buffer, and then save the description back to the video! If you thought Emacs Lisp was only for major and minor modes, this might prove that it can do a whole lot more.

entry.title: Trying Out Prot's Denote, an Org Roam Alternative?

media:group.media:title: Trying Out Prot's Denote, an Org Roam Alternative?
media:group.media:description:
In today's stream, we'll try out Prot's new note-taking package called Denote and see if we can come up with a comparable workflow to what you might get from a package like Org Roam. I really like the principles that Prot chose for this package so I'm looking forward to experimenting with it!

entry.title: Configuring Rational Emacs with Guix Home

media:group.media:title: Configuring Rational Emacs with Guix Home
media:group.media:description:
In today's stream, I'll lay the groundwork for using Rational Emacs in a Guix Home configuration! We'll define a Guix package for Rational Emacs and the Guix Home services necessary to produce working configuration. I'm not exactly sure how everything will work, but we'll figure it out together!
